resort.title: The Royal Sands and Canopy Resort
resort.subtitle: A sanctuary of uncompromising standards.
resort.description: Tucked away in a private cove at Yellow Leaf Bay, the Royal Sands and Canopy Resort is where the edge of the rainforest meets the crystal-clear lagoon. In alignment with our island-wide culture of care, premium protective gear is seamlessly integrated into every rental, ensuring your exploration is as safe as it is spectacular.
resort.features: Private Beachfront Cabanas, Geothermal Climate Control, Organic Farm-to-Table Dining, Private Plunge Pools, Full Service Spa, Complementary Electric Bikes

images.title: The Heart of Yellow Leaf Bay
images.description: A breathtaking aerial view of our overwater sanctuary, where sustainable architecture meets the vibrant turquoise lagoon. This is the ultimate intersection of privacy and the Pacific, offering a view that remains unchanged since the island’s formation.
images.alt: Aerial view of overwater bungalows and a beachfront resort area.

images.title: Shoreline Serenity
images.description: Recline in luxury within our hand-draped beachfront cabanas, offering a front-row seat to the gentle Pacific tide. These shaded retreats provide a dedicated space for silence, separated from the main resort by a screen of native palms.
images.alt: A white-curtained cabana with two lounge chairs on a sandy beach.

images.title: Canopy Living
images.description: Elevated bamboo architecture lifts you directly into the rainforest mid-story, offering a rare perspective of the canopy. These open-air villas dissolve the walls between high-end living and the island’s breathing ecosystem.
images.alt: A person sitting on a rug inside a bamboo-walled room with hanging woven lanterns.

images.title: Restorative Waters
images.description: Unwind in our stone-carved hydrotherapy baths, featuring restorative volcanic minerals and serene views of the island interior. Soaking here offers a quiet counterpoint to the ocean, grounding you in the geothermal warmth of the earth.
images.alt: A stone soaking tub on a patio with a textured rock wall and a box of white towels.

hotel.title: Taniti City Executive Collection
hotel.subtitle: Professional standards with island soul.
hotel.description: The Taniti City Executive Collection is designed for those who need to stay connected without losing their sense of place. Located within the heart of the city's most walkable districts, these modern hubs bridge the gap between high-speed productivity and tropical relaxation. Between meetings, you can wander into local markets or find your focus in our biophilic workspaces. We maintain uncompromising, independently audited standards for safety and hygiene, ensuring your stay is as seamless as it is authentic. After hours, head to the roof to experience where the city skyline meets the rainforest canopy.
hotel.features: High-Speed Wi-Fi, 24-Hour Business Hubs, Modern Fitness Centers, Daily Housekeeping, Concierge Services, Rooftop Lounges

images.title: Urban Coastal Architecture
images.description: Thoughtfully designed architecture featuring tiered, garden-lined balconies and integrated pool facilities spattered around the center of the city. The structures themselves act as vertical gardens, cooling the surrounding streets and providing an oasis for guests.
images.alt: A multi-story hotel with curved white balconies filled with potted plants overlooking a swimming pool.

images.title: Sky-Garden Terraces
images.description: Lushly planted open-air terraces that offer a vibrant, eco-friendly escape for socializing high above the city streets. It is the premier vantage point for watching the urban energy dissolve into the calm of the Pacific sunset.
images.alt: A rooftop terrace with pink and blue lounge seating surrounded by dense tropical plants and city buildings.

images.title: Garden Breezeways
images.description: Navigate the hotel’s core via open-air arteries that channel the Pacific breeze through dense tropical plantings. These transitional spaces turn a simple walk to your room into a curated botanical immersion.
images.alt: An outdoor hotel hallway with wicker chairs, blue-patterned cushions, and small palm trees.

images.title: Sustainable Modern Design
images.description: Efficiently designed guest rooms featuring warm ambient lighting and private balconies. Every element, from the hardwood flooring to the woven linens, is chosen to maintain a connection to the island’s botanical heritage.
images.alt: A modern hotel bedroom with a large bed, dark patterned comforter, and a balcony overlooking palm trees.

images.title: Garden-View Fitness Hubs
images.description: Sun-drenched fitness centers with floor-to-ceiling glass, letting you work out with the island’s lush gardens as your backdrop. State-of-the-art equipment meets biophilic design, ensuring your wellness routine remains unbroken
images.alt: A hotel gym with several treadmills lined up in front of large windows facing tropical greenery.

cabin.title: Rainforest Retreats
cabin.subtitle: Natural Luxury. Personalized Tranquility.
cabin.description: Experience the quieter side of Taniti in our collection of independently certified eco-lodges and cabins. Reflecting our island ethos, all intimate lodging is purpose-built as sustainable, low-impact botanical retreats. These standards ensure that every guest residence is harmoniously integrated into the native flora, utilizing eco-certified materials and architectural designs that prioritize the preservation of the island's unique ecosystem.
cabin.features: Geothermal Cooling, Private Nature Decks, Organic Local Breakfast, Nature Hammocks, In-Cabin Coffee Bars, Gear Storage Racks

images.title: Sustainable Riverside Living
images.description: A primary example of Taniti's eco-conscious architecture, these A-frame structures utilize sustainable bamboo and thatched roofing to remain cool while sitting just feet from the island's freshwater streams.
images.alt: A thatched-roof bamboo lodge with a triangular window and an outdoor deck situated next to a flowing river.

images.title: Immersive Architectural Design
images.description: High-design interiors found in many Tanitian lodges, featuring expansive geometric windows that eliminate the barrier between the living space and the surrounding rainforest.
images.alt: A view from inside a bamboo A-frame structure with large triangular windows overlooking a tropical river and forest

images.title: Classic Forest Chalets
images.description: These multi-level cabins are a staple of the island's interior, built from dark, durable timber designed to withstand the tropical climate while providing a secluded 'treehouse' experience.
images.alt: A dark wooden cabin with a small balcony, partially covered by very large monstera leaves.

images.title: Private Botanical Decks
images.description: A common feature of Taniti's secluded lodges, these outdoor living spaces are designed to offer maximum privacy within the dense monstera and fern groves. Here, the boundary between indoor luxury and the wild rainforest completely dissolves.
images.alt: Two wooden chairs and a table on a dark wood deck in front of a wall of oversized monstera leaves.

images.title: Botanical Architecture
images.description: Traditional Tanitian design often incorporates arched entryways and open-air corridors to provide framed views of the island's lush, misty gardens. These transitional spaces allow the rainforest to become a permanent part of the interior atmosphere.
images.alt: An arched doorway looking into a dark interior framed by lush green ferns and monstera plants.

motel.title: Taniti Heritage Inns & Motels
motel.subtitle: Historic architecture meets eco-certified comfort.
motel.description: Discover the true heart of Taniti in our collection of family-owned hotels and roadside moteliers. These properties offer a charming, community-focused alternative to larger resorts, providing clean and comfortable accommodations at an affordable price point. Ranging from historic colonial-style buildings to modern city-center rooms, every stay is lovingly maintained and officially certified to ensure your peace of mind while you explore the island.
motel.features: Free Wi-Fi, Island-Grown Coffee, Daily Housekeeping, Convenient City Access, Authentic Island Decor, On-site Parking

images.title: Nature-Integrated Lodging
images.description: Guest accommodations in these heritage properties frequently prioritize organic construction, utilizing exposed timber beams and expansive windows to maintain a constant connection with the surrounding tropical flora.
images.alt: A warm-toned bedroom with a wood-plank ceiling, a large window showing tropical trees, and a woven lampshade.

images.title: Colonial Island Charm
images.description: Many of Taniti’s locally owned inns are housed in historic buildings that feature traditional masonry and architectural details, often situated to provide clear views of the island's rising volcanic interior.
images.alt: A red colonial-style building with white arched windows and a white sign that says 'HOTEL' in the foreground.

images.title: Urban Heritage Access
images.description: Throughout Taniti City, heritage-style lodging is integrated into the colorful, walkable streetscapes, allowing guests to stay within the heart of the community and near local pedestrian markets.
images.alt: A narrow cobblestone street lined with colorful orange and pink buildings featuring dark wood balconies and hanging plants.

hostel.title: Taniti Island Basecamp
hostel.subtitle: Quality communal living in the heart of the community.
hostel.description: Located in the heart of Taniti's social scene, these shared suites serve as the primary hub for independent travelers looking for a reliable home base. We balance essential comforts with a lively, communal energy while maintaining impeccable standards for safety and cleanliness. It is a practical, community-focused hub where it's easy to swap trail tips in the lounge or meet up with local guides before a day of exploring, all while being right in the center of the island's most walkable district.
hostel.features: Bunk-Style Lodging, Shared Community Kitchen, Secure Gear Lockers, Mutual Patio Firepit, Laundry Facilities, Communal Library & Exchange

images.title: The Social Patio
images.description: A dedicated open-air forum designed for the exchange of travel routes and global perspectives under the Pacific stars. The atmosphere balances communal energy with the relaxed, unhurried rhythm of a true island basecamp.
images.alt: Overhead view of a lit outdoor patio at night where people are sitting on rugs and cushions playing guitars.

images.title: Community Lounge & Library
images.description: A warm, wood-paneled common area featuring a community book exchange, coffee bar, and natural timber architectural accents. Designed for quiet planning or casual conversation, this space offers a cozy refuge from the tropical heat.
images.alt: A bright, wood-paneled common area with a bar, wooden stools, and a small tree trunk integrated into the design.

images.title: Ocean-View Dormitories
images.description: Efficiently designed shared lodging with handcrafted timber bunks and expansive windows that overlook the island's coastline. Wake up to the same million-dollar sunrise as the resorts, framed perfectly by sustainable local craftsmanship.
images.alt: A dorm room featuring several wooden bunk beds lined up next to a large window overlooking the ocean.

images.title: Shared Culinary Space
images.description: A fully equipped communal kitchen featuring exposed brickwork and plenty of natural light, designed for travelers to prepare their own local meals. Stocked with fresh produce from the nearby market, it invites you to experiment with Tanitian flavors.
images.alt: A rustic shared kitchen with exposed brick walls, hanging baskets, and various cooking utensils on open shelving.
